Field.Name: ALL
Field.Description: All terms from all searchable fields

Field.Name: MESH
Field.Description: Medical Subject Headings assigned to publication

Field.Name: MAJR
Field.Description: MeSH terms of major importance to publication

Field.Name: ECNO
Field.Description: EC number for enzyme or CAS registry number

Field.Name: SUBS
Field.Description: CAS chemical name or MEDLINE Substance Name

Field.Name: EDAT
Field.Description: Date publication first accessible through Entrez

Field.Name: SI
Field.Description: Cross-reference from publication to other databases

Field.Name: MHDA
Field.Description: Date publication was indexed with MeSH terms

Field.Name: TT
Field.Description: Words in transliterated title of publication

Field.Name: CRDT
Field.Description: Date publication first accessible through Entrez

Field.Name: BOOK
Field.Description: ID of the book that contains the document

Link.Name: pubmed_assembly
Link.Description: Assembly

Link.Name: pubmed_bioproject
Link.Description: Related Projects

Link.Name: pubmed_biosample
Link.Description: BioSample links

Link.Name: pubmed_biosystems
Link.Description: Pathways and biological systems (BioSystems) that cite the current articles. Citations are from the BioSystems source databases (KEGG and BioCyc).

Link.Name: pubmed_books_refs
Link.Description: NCBI Bookshelf books that cite the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_cdd
Link.Description: Conserved Domain Database (CDD) records that cite the current articles. Citations are from the CDD source database records (PFAM, SMART).

Link.Name: pubmed_dbvar
Link.Description: Link from PubMed to dbVar

Link.Name: pubmed_epigenomics_experiment
Link.Description: Links to experimental data from epigenomic studies

Link.Name: pubmed_epigenomics_sample
Link.Description: Links to descriptions of biological samples used in epigenomic studies

Link.Name: pubmed_epigenomics_study
Link.Description: Links to overviews of epigenomic studies

Link.Name: pubmed_gap
Link.Description: Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) studies that cite the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_gds
Link.Description: Gene expression and molecular abundance data reported in the current articles that are also included in the curated Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) DataSets.

Link.Name: pubmed_gene
Link.Description: Gene records that cite the current articles. Citations in Gene are added manually by NCBI or imported from outside public resources.

Link.Name: pubmed_gene_bookrecords
Link.Description: Gene records in this citation

Link.Name: pubmed_gene_citedinomim
Link.Description: Gene records associated with Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) records that cite the current articles in their reference lists.

Link.Name: pubmed_gene_rif
Link.Description: Gene records that have the current articles as Reference into Function citations (GeneRIFs). NLM staff reviewing the literature while indexing MEDLINE add GeneRIFs manually.

Link.Name: pubmed_genome
Link.Description: Genome records that include the current articles as references. These are typically the articles that report the sequencing and analysis of the genome.

Link.Name: pubmed_geoprofiles
Link.Description: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Profiles of molecular abundance data. The current articles are references on the Gene record associated with the GEO profile.

Link.Name: pubmed_homologene
Link.Description: HomoloGene clusters of homologous genes and sequences that cite the current articles. These are references on the Gene and sequence records in the HomoloGene entry.

Link.Name: pubmed_medgen
Link.Description: Related information in MedGen

Link.Name: pubmed_medgen_omim
Link.Description: Related information in MedGen (OMIM)

Link.Name: pubmed_nuccore
Link.Description: Primary database (GenBank) nucleotide records reported in the current articles as well as Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that include the articles as references.

Link.Name: pubmed_nuccore_refseq
Link.Description: NCBI nucleotide Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that are cited in the current articles, included in the corresponding Gene Reference into Function, or that include the PubMed articles as references.

Link.Name: pubmed_nuccore_weighted
Link.Description: Nucleotide records associated with the current articles through the Gene database. These are the related sequences on the Gene record that are added manually by NCBI.

Link.Name: pubmed_nucest
Link.Description: Expressed Sequence Tag (EST) nucleotide sequence records reported in the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_nucgss
Link.Description: Genome Survey Sequence (GSS) nucleotide records reported in the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_omia
Link.Description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Animals (OMIA) records that cite the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_omim_bookrecords
Link.Description: OMIM records in this citation

Link.Name: pubmed_omim_calculated
Link.Description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) records that include the current articles as references in the light bulb links within or in the citations at the end of the OMIM record. The references available through the light bulb link are collected using the PubMed related articles algorithm to identify records with similar terminology to the OMIM record.

Link.Name: pubmed_omim_cited
Link.Description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) records that include the current articles as reference cited at the end of the OMIM record.

Link.Name: pubmed_pcassay
Link.Description: PubChem BioAssay experiments on the biological activities of small molecules that cite the current articles. The depositors of BioAssay data provide these references.

Link.Name: pubmed_pccompound
Link.Description: PubChem chemical compound records that cite the current articles. These references are taken from those provided on submitted PubChem chemical substance records. Multiple substance records may contribute to the PubChem compound record.

Link.Name: pubmed_pccompound_mesh
Link.Description: PubChem chemical compound records that are classified under the same Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) controlled vocabulary as the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_pccompound_publisher
Link.Description: Link to publisher deposited structures in the PubChem Compound database.

Link.Name: pubmed_pcsubstance
Link.Description: PubChem chemical substance records that cite the current articles. These references are taken from those provided on submitted PubChem chemical substance records.

Link.Name: pubmed_pcsubstance_bookrecords
Link.Description: Structures in the PubChem Substance database in this citation

Link.Name: pubmed_pcsubstance_mesh
Link.Description: PubChem chemical substance (submitted) records that are classified under the same Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) controlled vocabulary as the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_pcsubstance_publisher
Link.Description: Publisher deposited structures in the PubChem Compound database that are reported in the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_pmc
Link.Description: Free full-text versions of the current articles in the PubMed Central database.

Link.Name: pubmed_pmc_bookrecords
Link.Menu: References in PMC for this Bookshelf citation
Link.Description: Full text of articles in PubMed Central cited in this record

Link.Name: pubmed_pmc_embargo
Link.Description: Embargoed PMC article associated with PubMed

Link.Name: pubmed_pmc_local
Link.Description: Free full text articles in PMC

Link.Name: pubmed_pmc_refs
Link.Description: Full-text articles in the PubMed Central Database that cite the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_popset
Link.Description: Sets of sequences from population and evolutionary genetic studies in the PopSet database reported in the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_probe
Link.Description: Molecular reagents in the Probe database that cite the current articles. References in Probe are provided by submitters of the data.

Link.Name: pubmed_protein
Link.Description: Protein translation features of primary database (GenBank) nucleotide records reported in the current articles as well as Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that include the articles as references.

Link.Name: pubmed_protein_refseq
Link.Description: NCBI protein Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that are cited in the current articles, included in the corresponding Gene Reference into Function, or that include the PubMed articles as references.

Link.Name: pubmed_protein_weighted
Link.Description: Protein records associated with the current articles through related Gene database records. These are the related sequences on the Gene record that are added manually by NCBI.

Link.Name: pubmed_proteinclusters
Link.Description: Clusters of related proteins from the Protein Clusters database that cite the current articles. Sources of references in Protein Clusters include the associated Gene and Conserved Domain records as well as NCBI added citations.

Link.Name: pubmed_pubmed
Link.Description: Calculated set of PubMed citations closely related to the selected article(s) retrieved using a word weight algorithm. Related articles are displayed in ranked order from most to least relevant, with the “linked from” citation displayed first.

Link.Name: pubmed_pubmed_bookrecords
Link.Description: PubMed abstracts for articles cited in this record

Link.Name: pubmed_pubmed_refs
Link.Description: Citation referenced in PubMed article. Only valid for PubMed citations that are also in PMC.

Link.Name: pubmed_snp
Link.Description: Nucleotide polymorphism records from dbSNP that have current articles as submitter-provided references.

Link.Name: pubmed_snp_cited
Link.Description: Nucleotide polymorphism records from dbSNP that have NCBI dbSNP identifiers reported in the PubMed abstract of the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_sra
Link.Description: Massively-parallel sequencing project data in the Short Read Archive (SRA) that are reported in the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_structure
Link.Description: Three-dimensional structure records in the NCBI Structure database for data reported in the current articles.

Link.Name: pubmed_taxonomy_entrez
Link.Description: Taxonomy records associated with the current articles through taxonomic information on related molecular database records (Nucleotide, Protein, Gene, SNP, Structure).

Link.Name: pubmed_unigene
Link.Description: UniGene clusters of expressed sequences that are associated with the current articles through references on the clustered sequence records and related Gene records.

Link.Name: pubmed_unists
Link.Description: Genetic, physical, and sequence mapping reagents in the UniSTS database associated with the current articles through references on sequence tagged site (STS) submissions as well as automated searching of PubMed abstracts and full-text PubMed Central articles for marker names.
